segments.text: I can't believe what I'm witnessing in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman continues to dry her plate, completely oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is entirely on that one mundane task, as if nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is still overflowing, a steady stream of water onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A growing puddle is now quite large, surrounding her feet completely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even flinch, which is truly perplexing to me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the children are engaged in a risky cookie heist just behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balanced on that incredibly wobbly stool, reaching for treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me a bit angry that she's so disconnected from her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she feel the water? Doesn't she hear the running faucet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of distraction feels almost negligent, considering the dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to call out to her and tell her to look around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene is full of small disasters waiting for one big consequence.
segments.speaker: PAR
